result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Austin Sewell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness/Person Charged/Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.43(7).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No contact with victim.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

supervisions.notes: Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle Austin Sewell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in custody.    Peter Michael Tempelis and William Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

Parties have reached a resolution.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by victim. Statements by parties and defendant. 

The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 5 years, consecutive to any other sentence, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2.5 years, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2.5 years. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-No contact with victim.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in custody.  Peter Michael Tempelis and William Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties discussed pretrial Motions and issues; rulings placed on the record.  State's final offer placed on the record; defendant rejects offer.  Case passed.  

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:25 am.  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury list received and filed.  Court releases jurors for lunch.

Sidebars placed on the record.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Case adjourned to 2:00 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kyle Austin Sewell not in court, in custody.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case calendared for jury trial today.  Both parties advised the Court that they are ready to proceed.  Parties discussed how the trial will proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell not in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Judge Kremers is hearing this case for Judge Havas. Material Witness Amanda Lee brought into court on the previously issued body attachment. The court admonished the witness and the witness was personally served with a subpoena to appear on March 28, 2016 in Judge Havas court for trial.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kyle Austin Sewell not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by parties.  State's motion to admit statements through the doctrine of forfeiture by wrongdoing is denied by the Court.  Case remains in a jury trial posture.  State has turned over a copy of all jail calls made by defendant.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 3-28-2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 45.

Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in custody.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State's motion to admit statements through the doctrine of forfeiture by wrongdoing, argued.  Court takes motion under advisement.  Case adjourned for Decision to Branch 45.  Decision scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Response to the State's Motion to Admit Statements Through the Doctrine of Forfeiture by Wrongdoing, received and filed.
Body Attachment given to state for service.
Court advised that witness had been subpoenaed and served.  Order for body attachment for defaulting witness.  BODY ATTACHMENT ISSUED as to Amanda Lee.  Witness to be returned between 8AM and 4PM.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kyle Austin Sewell not in court, in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is serving a sentence until December 2016.  Victim has failed to appear.
IN CHAMBERS DISCUSSION is held.
Case recalled.  The state is requesting a body attachment as to defaulting witness.  State has filed a Motion to Admit Statements through the Doctrine of Forfeiture by Wrongdoing.  The court denies the defense motion to dismiss and will set a new FPT/Motion date of 2-25-2016 and a new trial date of 3-28-2016.  
The defense is objection to the motion and may file a response (but is not required to) a week prior to the FPT date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kyle Austin Sewell not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Due to Branch 4 in trial and the unavailability of a spin court, Court ordered Jury Trial adjourned to Branch 38 on 12-14-2015 at 8:15 am.   Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kyle Austin Sewell not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel for the purposes of the first call.  Victim is present.  Parties are prepared to proceed to trial.  Case passed.
to Adjourn from defense, received and filed.   mld
Notice of Motion and Motion to Admit Statements Though the Doctrine of Forfeiture by Wrongdoing and State's Brief On Forfeiture By Wrongdoing received and filed.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kyle Austin Sewell not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State will be filing a Forfeiture Notice.  Defense counsel can respond on the date of trial, per the Court.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-22-2015 at 8:15  am.   mld

Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Upon the motion of the State, with no objection by defense, Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial: Cases 2015CF990 and 2015CF2052.  The State will forward the discovery and an offer to defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-26-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 7-22-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
Upon the request of defense counsel, Preliminary Hearing rescheduled in Branch 4 from 5-14-2015 at 8:30 am to 5-18-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Amanda L or Georgia L

Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Kyle Austin Sewell in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
